column36: Mixed form this year and, like many, has a major stamina query; taken on
column37: One of the original three declared; produced a good effort on his seasonal return in the Yorkshire Cup (1m6f, good to firm) having been gelded; has failed to reproduce that, although not disgraced in a Listed race at Chester (1m6.5f, good) last time; well beaten on his two goes at about 2m, so has major stamina questions to answer over this new trip; Lukas Delozier rides for first time.

column36: Certainly has the class to play a part but whether he'll stay is a big question
column37: Another of the original declarations and he possesses the class to win judged on peak efforts, but has serious stamina questions to answer after being beaten 22l in the Doncaster Cup (2m2f) last time, albeit having gone quickly up front (runs without blinkers time); needs to recapture the form of his Goodwood Cup fourth (2m, good) three starts back; Cristian Demuro on for first time.

column36: Interesting that she goes up in trip; player if stamina lasts out
column37: Exciting over 7f as a 2yo on her day and runner-up in the Prix de Diane (1m2.5f, good to soft) this June, showing she could get further; matched her best when third in the Prix Vermeille upped to 1m4f at Longchamp (good to soft) last time but this further step up in trip is a concern given her dam is a dual Nunthorpe winner (5f Group 1); player if she stays.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Listed win in France in July and placed twice at Group 3 level over 7f since; player
column37: Listed winner at Deauville (1m, soft) in July and even better form when placed in 7f Group 3s at Goodwood (good) and Doncaster (soft; beaten a short head) since; a 3lb penalty for the French success shouldn't prevent a prominent showing.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Second in 7f Listed on reappearance but below par since
column37: Listed runner-up on seasonal return at Musselburgh (7f, good) in June but below that level on all three outings since; a bounce back is needed.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Has reached frame at Listed level in recent starts but needs more to win in this grade
column37: Irish mare who landed a Curragh handicap in June; has reached the frame in Listed races at Naas (6f, yielding) and Newbury (7f, good to soft) since but needs more to win in this grade.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Disappointed in Listed latest but largely progressive prior to that; yard won this in 2022
column37: Dual 7f scorer on AW who advanced her form again when landing a 6f fillies' handicap at Glorious Goodwood (good) in July; disappointing when stepped up to Listed company at Newmarket (6f again) six weeks ago but her overall profile is positive and the stable won this in 2022.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Twice runner-up at this level but well held in Group 3s last twice; blinkers applied
column37: Listed runner-up at Newmarket (1m, heavy) last September and Chelmsford (7f, AW) this July; however, she now needs to shrug off poor runs in Group 3s at Sandown and Goodwood in recent months; blinkered for the first time.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Unbeaten in two novices for William Haggas a year apart; off another 11 months
column37: Useful form when winner of novices at Newmarket (7f, heavy) and Nottingham (1m, soft) for William Haggas just under a year apart; absent for a further 11 months ahead of this first outing for a new stable; open to further progress but this demands a good chunk of improvement.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Went close in French Listed race on reappearance but below that level since
column37: Went close in Listed race at Longchamp (7f, good to soft) on reappearance but unable to make an impact in three runs since, including behind Bright Thunder and Miss Nightfall in Doncaster Group 3 on latest.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Ninth in two Group 3s this year but won this race last year on soft; revival not ruled out
column37: Ended last season with a win in this race on soft ground for William Haggas; ninth in Group 3 events on both runs for David O'Meara but she wasn't beaten that far at Doncaster latterly and might strip fitter now as that was her first outing for three months; not discounted.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Consistent record and travels through her races as though the drop back to 7f could suit
column37: Won her maiden on AW in the spring and has proved consistent since, including in course handicap at the Royal meeting and at Listed/Group 3 level; quite a keen goer and this drop to 7f for the time since her debut could be a good move; acts on soft; gets the vote.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Winner of 7f Redcar novice latest; more to come but this is a jump in class
column37: Form figures of 221 reflect a solid start to her career, scoring comfortably at Redcar (7f, good) most recently; this $625,000 daughter of Kingman looks the type to progress further but this is a jump in class.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Back on the up with 7f Class 3 handicap win latest but this demands more
column37: Back on the up when leading towards the finish in 7f Thirsk handicap (good) four weeks ago but a fair bit more will be needed in this higher grade.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column32: B V Sangster, Mrs P Shanahan, Mrs M V Magnier
column36: Listed winner on heavy at 2; good third in handicap latest; tongue-tie added
column37: Landed a 7f Listed event in the mud on her final 2yo start; best effort of the current campaign when third of 11 in 7f Sandown handicap (soft) five weeks ago; tongue-tied first time; place shout if the ground becomes testing.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Excellent second in 1,000 Guineas on reappearance but has regressed since
column37: Excellent second in the 1,000 Guineas at Newmarket (1m, good to firm; acts on good to soft) on seasonal return; the one to beat on that form but she's regressed in three outings since, including when well behind some of these at Sandown (1m, soft) five weeks ago.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Has reached the frame in sprint Listed races last twice but stamina to prove back at 7f
column37: Lightly raced 3yo who showed improved form when a Listed runner-up at 16-1 at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) in August; backed that up and showed she's as effective on a soft surface when fourth of 12 in another Listed race at Ayr (5.5f) a fortnight ago; weakened on previous attempt at 7f so has stamina to prove.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: Has run well in defeat on all starts this year; fifth in 7f Group 3 on soft latest; claims
column37: 3yo who has run well in defeat on all five starts this term, producing a career-best RPR when stepped up to Group 3 company at Doncaster (7f, soft) last time; each-way claims.

column4: BetMGM British EBF October Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
column20: 7/2 Bright Thunder, 5/1 Cajole, 6/1 Flight, 15/2 Miss Nightfall, 8/1 Nardra, 12/1 Sunfall, 14/1 Dubai Treasure,  Magic Basma, 16/1 Circios,  Ellaria Sand, 20/1 Fair Point,  Dash Of Azure, 25/1 Arolla,  Bellaphina,  Love Dynasty,  Queen's Reign
column36: 5th in Group 3 on return and quick ground possibly against her since; retains potential
column37: Well-bred filly who impressed when beating three rivals on debut at Haydock (6f, soft) last autumn; good fifth of ten in Group 3 Nell Gwyn at Newmarket (7f, good to soft) on reappearance in April and possibly unsuited by quicker ground when turned over at short odds back in novice company over 6f at Leicester in July; off since and retains potential for a very much in-form stable with a good record in this race.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Improved of late, winning Beverley Bullet and second in Group 3 at Newbury; respected
column37: Tough sprinter who has improved of late, winning the Listed Beverley Bullet (5f, good to firm) in August and finishing clear of the rest when second of 14 in Group 3 at Newbury (5f, good to soft) in September; tactically versatile and may not have reached his ceiling just yet; commands respect.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column27: Exors Of The Late Mr W C Wragg
column36: Beat his 24 rivals in Ayr Silver Cup two weeks ago, making all; set for a bold show
column37: Came good last autumn, winning three times, and he confirmed that this is his time of year by posting a personal best to beat his 24 rivals in the Ayr Silver Cup (6f, soft; made all) two weeks ago; hasn't run over 5f since the early part of his 2yo campaign but gives the impression this trip may well suit; well worth his place back in a Listed race and set for a bold show.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Won C&D handicap in July; far from disgraced in Newbury Group 3 next time; not ruled out
column37: Come-from-behind sprinter who picked up well to win C&D handicap (good ground; has won on soft) in July and was far from disgraced when fourth in Newbury Group 3 next time; has a bit to find with Shagraan judged on that last piece of form but returning to Ascot could suit and he's not discounted.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column27: P Taplin & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
column36: Progressive 3yo; won handicap at Doncaster last month; more required in this higher grade
column37: Low-mileage 3yo who continues to raise his game, defying top weight in handicap at Doncaster (5f, soft) three weeks ago in game fashion; may have more in the tank but he'll need it in this higher grade.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: High-class on his day but disappointing of late and needs a revival
column37: High-class on his day but disappointing of late, finishing well behind Shagraan at Beverley and Newbury on his last two starts; needs a revival.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Runner-up 12 months ago; easy winner of fillies' Listed race last time; still unexposed
column37: Beaten only by triple Group 3 winner Rumstar in this race 12 months ago and she took her form to an even higher level when running away with a fillies' Listed event at Ayr (5.5f, soft) last month; fresher than most after just two outings this year and she may still have untapped potential.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Likeable mare; arrives after back-to-back handicap wins at Beverley; this is much tougher
column37: Likeable mare who is as good as ever at the age of eight and arrives after back-to-back handicap wins at Beverley (5f, soft); however, this is a steep rise in class and others have much more obvious claims on form.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Hasn't repeated form of easy Goodwood handicap success but could be revived by a break
column37: All four wins at 5f on good ground or softer, bolting up in handicap at Goodwood in May; well below par in two subsequent runs but she's had over two months off since and could be revived; not without hope if so.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Well-bred filly; on a retrieval mission after disappointing efforts in two 6f Listed races
column37: Well-bred filly (a half-sister to the 2,000 Guineas winner Chaldean) who looked a smart prospect when winning 5f handicap at Sandown (5f, good; shaped well on soft) in July; has not gone on as anticipated in 6f Listed races since, and she's on a retrieval mission here.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Has finished out of the frame in handicaps this year; looks out of her depth in this grade
column37: Won her first two races last season but has finished out of the frame in three handicaps this year and looks out of her depth in this grade.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Has had six goes in Listed races and been unplaced each time; hard to fancy
column37: Has had six goes in Listed races and been unplaced each time, most recently when sixth at Pontefract (50-1) in August; hard to fancy.

column20: 11/4 Beautiful Diamond, 100/30 Shagraan, 9/2 Candy, 6/1 Cover Up, 9/1 Kerdos, 14/1 Enchanting,  Kassaya, 16/1 Woolhampton, 20/1 Getreadytorumble, 33/1 Elegant Erin, 50/1 Pearl Of Windsor, 66/1 Minnie Wildes
column36: Needs to bounce back from below-par run but loves at Ascot and plenty of rain would suit
column37: At least as good as ever this year, winning handicaps at Sandown (5f, soft) and over C&D (good to soft) in September; found things happening too quickly at Haydock last Saturday and she's in deeper today, but she does go really well at Ascot and the more rain that falls the better.

column20: 15/8 Hamish, 9/4 Al Qareem, 9/2 Military Academy, 6/1 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Tenability
column36: Won this in 2023 and 2024; front-running 6yo who has pulled out more time and time again
column37: Front-running 6yo who has pulled out more time and time again, with 11 wins now to his credit, including in this race in 2023 (good) and 2024 (soft); his three wins this season were all 1m6f but he stepped back to 1m4f on soft to excellent effect last autumn; outclassed in a top Group 2 and a Group 1 on last two outings, forgivable; has a 3lb penalty, which he did not carry in the last two runnings of this, but highly respected.

column20: 15/8 Hamish, 9/4 Al Qareem, 9/2 Military Academy, 6/1 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Tenability
column36: Long and distinguished career includes a win in this race in 2022; leading form claims
column37: 9yo who's won a hatful of Group 3s at 1m4f-1m6f in his long and distinguished career, including this race in 2022; also won 1m4f Listed races on last three outings, including in a good scrap involving Military Academy at Goodwood in June and when that rival disappointed at Chester three weeks ago; all of his turf starts in the last six years have been on softer than good; back up to Group 3 but with leading form claims again and a tremendous attitude.

column20: 15/8 Hamish, 9/4 Al Qareem, 9/2 Military Academy, 6/1 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Tenability
column36: Neck 2nd to Hamish at levels in June (1m4f, soft); overall record prompts some disquiet
column37: 3-4 last term, notably with 1m4f Listed win on AW; cheekpieces have gone on this season, with two solid seconds; excuses are available for the modest shows on his other three starts this term, having first run at idiosyncratic Chester when lacklustre behind Hamish last time; went down by a neck to same rival when level weights at Goodwood (1m4f, soft) in June, showing easily his best turf form, but overall record has to prompt some disquiet.

column20: 15/8 Hamish, 9/4 Al Qareem, 9/2 Military Academy, 6/1 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Tenability
column36: 40-1 fifth in the Irish Derby (1m4f, good) in June, well in advance of his other ratings
column37: 40-1 fifth of ten in the Irish Derby (1m4f, good) in June, front rank long way; it's a concern that his rating that day is well in advance of his others, and also that he was beaten so far in the storm at Glorious Goodwood on latest outing, but he needs a second look with tongue tied first time.

column20: 15/8 Hamish, 9/4 Al Qareem, 9/2 Military Academy, 6/1 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Tenability
column36: Needs plenty more and Hamish looks yard first string, but this is a highly progressive 3yo
column37: Won a novice and three C&D handicaps on varied ground on his last four starts; latest was a big prize on soft, which he took when the first two drew clear; this race demands a hefty dose of further improvement and Hamish looks the stable first string, but this is a highly progressive 3yo.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Suited by York but has won here; not dismissed despite penalty for Group 3 win in June
column37: Has won a 7f handicap on this track but his best efforts have been when front-running at York, as when winning a 6f Listed race (good to soft) last September and a 7f Group 3 (good) in June; penalised for the latter but not dismissed back at 6f.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Won this in 2023; winless in Britain since but retains ability; could easily figure
column37: Won this in 2023 (good; equally effective on soft); winless in Britain since but he's often been highly tried and narrow defeats in a Salisbury Listed race (6f) and an AW Group 3 this year confirm he retains his ability; could easily be in the thick of it back down in class.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Many close calls in top 6f handicaps and richly deserved his win here last year; bold bid
column37: A very popular winner of this race (soft) last year, following some staunch efforts in top 6f handicaps; was back in familiar territory when a close second of 21 in the Portland at Doncaster (about 5f, good) in September, as he had been 12 months ago, and a bold bid is very much on the cards.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Strong form chance on Listed York win (3-4 over 6f there); first run on this stiffer track
column37: Better than ever when winning a Listed race at York (good; Prince Of India a close third) last time out; strong form chance but he's particularly well suited by that track (3-4 over 6f) and needs to show he can handle this stiffer test on first course run.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Mostly vulnerable but soft ground helped when winning Ayr Gold Cup; serious rain a help
column37: Several good efforts in defeat against top 6f handicappers this year but he never shifted much in the weights and the return to soft ground may have made the difference when he made nearly all to win the Ayr Gold Cup recently; serious rain would bring him into the reckoning.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Useful 2yo at 5f; limited appeal on this year's form and has lots to find at the weights
column37: Useful 2yo last year, finishing placed in a Group 3 over 5f at Newmarket (soft), but has not looked worth his mark in 5f handicaps on last two starts and he has lots to find back over 6f on these unfavourable terms.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Two good wins, including C&D, since dropped to 6f; 3rd to Elmonjed latest; can do better
column37: Best of his three 2yo runs was on soft ground; first two wins over 7f but he soon outgrew handicaps once dropped to 6f this summer, coming home in isolation on his side at Newmarket and proving suited by this stiff C&D (both good to firm) when following up; seen to lesser effect over the easy 6f at York (good, Listed; slightly squeezed) since, when a persevering close third of nine to Elmonjed, but he can do better back here; has every chance.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Better than ever with ready 6f wins on turf/AW; checked in run latest; remains of interest
column37: Five wins this year, the latest two with authority in Racing League races over 6f at Yarmouth (soft) and on Newcastle AW; travelled strongly but the Red Sea failed to part in a big Curragh handicap (6f, yielding) last month; still improving and one of the more interesting ones.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Six wins in 2024; respectable return in September but needs to outrun her mark to feature
column37: Stellar season in 2024, winning six times at 6f and 7f (on ground ranging from good to firm to good to soft); respectable belated return in the Ayr Gold Cup two weeks ago but needs to outrun her mark to feature.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Seven outings this year, winning 7f Listed race in June; up against it on rare 6f run
column37: One win from seven starts in 2025, making rather heavy weather of a Listed Musselburgh race (7f, good; odds-on) in June; looks up against it pitting her wits against 6f specialists on rare run at this trip; cheekpieces on.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Tearaway; won at 6f/7f; found zero on soft latest; worth a go back at 6f; tough at weights
column37: A tearaway who was hooded for first two wins, at 6f and 7f, but not for the latest at Newbury (7f, good to firm) in August when making most; found zero on soft ground at Doncaster since (7f; Group 3) and although the return to 6f offers hope she has work to do at the weights.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Progressive at 6f prior to hefty defeat at Ayr latest; up against it on these terms
column37: Kept taking steps forward, most recently when a cosy winner at Hamilton (6f, good; has won on heavy) in July so a hefty defeat as favourite for the Ayr Silver Cup since was a blow; perhaps fitting cheekpieces will help, perhaps not; up against it on these terms either way.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: Useful Listed win over 6f in May; found wanting in Group 3s since; brought down latest
column37: Reappeared with a useful Listed win at Newmarket (6f, good) in May but has been found wanting in Group 3s since and looks best watched after being brought down in a bad accident at York last month.

column20: 4/1 Elmonjed, 5/1 Prince Of India, 13/2 Apollo One, 7/1 Quinault,  Annaf, 12/1 Run Boy Run,  Jabaara,  Celandine, 20/1 Tuco Salamanca,  Alfa Kellenic,  Lou Lou's Gift,  Nariko, 25/1 Tiger Bay, 50/1 Kullazain
column36: All 3 wins at 6f on good to firm; missed race on good to soft in August so rain worrying
column37: Made the running for all three 6f wins on good to firm, the latest in a Group 2 at York last August; returned to the fray with a third of 11 in a Group 3 there in July but the threat of rain is a real one (missed a race on good to soft in August).

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column27: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
column32: Richard McNally & Leo Walsh & L Murrin
column36: A 6yo having his 20th start but better than ever this season; impressed at Leopardstown
column37: A 6yo having his 20th start but better than ever this season and did well to defy top weight so convincingly at Leopardstown (7f, good to yielding) having been dropped in from a bad draw; on the shortlist.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Off colour both runs this season but major chance on last year's high points
column37: As usual, he was held up before breezing through the field to win the Balmoral Handicap over 1m here last October (soft; 4lb lower); needs to put this season's performances behind him but arrives here fresh and rain would heighten interest.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: High-profile wins this year at 6f/7f; continues to run well despite a tough mark
column37: Had some season to have already bagged an International (C&D, good) and the Stewards' Cup (6f, good to soft); he might not be done yet as he was beaten under a length at the Ebor meeting and then never nearer than at the finish after starting slowly in the Ayr Gold Cup; may have little margin for error off current mark but can see him running well.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: 2-3 in a visor and still improving judged on last month's C&D win on good to soft
column37: Third in a Britannia on first run at Ascot and came through to beat a few of these on last month's return over this trip on good to soft, reversing previous Goodwood placings with Great Acclaim; raised 8lb but now 2-3 since the visor went on and still improving by the looks.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Form figures of 1122 since the blinkers went on; climbing the weights
column37: Form figures of 1122 since the blinkers went on, last time best of the rest behind Native Warrior over C&D; continues to climb the weights (up another 3lb) but looks sure to give it his best shot once more.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Rain welcomed as he likes soft ground, on which he stayed on best over 1m at Ayr recently
column37: Rain welcomed as he likes soft ground, on which he stayed on best over 1m at Ayr recently; that trip might be an ideal fit these days and was behind three of today's rivals over 7f here the time before.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Off since his Sandown win in May but has an excellent record when fresh
column37: Absent since winning over 1m at Sandown in May (good; fine on softer) but he has an excellent record when fresh and a 6lb rise isn't beyond him; a 9yo now but enters the reckoning.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Lacks consistency but produced a solid run in defeat at Listed level last time (1m, soft)
column37: Lacks consistency but produced a solid run in defeat at Listed level last time (1m, soft) and this drop back to 7f will be no hardship; Charles Bishop gets off to partner Great Acclaim but this 4yo is respected off a competitive mark.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column32: R A Pegum And P A Henry
column36: Just missed out on final run but was behind four of these here the time before
column37: Smart on the continent; some notable form in eight defeats for this yard, last time going down narrowly in a Class 3 at Newbury (7f, good to soft; second-time cheekpieces); however, he was behind four of these here the time before.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Likeable type but a career-high mark which could be troublesome in this deep a handicap
column37: Enhanced his fine Chester record when a length winner there in late August (extended 7f; good to firm; acts on soft); the 4lb rise elevates him to a career-high mark which could be troublesome in this deep a handicap.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column27: Hellwood Stud Farm & R C Dollar
column36: Unexposed at 7f and he was bang there in the Ayr Gold Cup two weeks ago
column37: Only 2-20 and but knows what these big-field handicaps are all about and was bang there when favourite for the Ayr Gold Cup two weeks ago (6f, soft; first-time cheekpieces); things didn't go to plan when he tried 7f once before; possible.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Most wins and peak form has been on the AW and turf struggles continue
column37: Most wins and peak form has been on the AW and never looked as though he would justify market support when behind Thunder Roar at Ayr recently.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Talented handicapper; out of luck of late but he'll pop up again one day
column37: Earlier this year he won easily at Doncaster before chasing home a subsequent Group 1 winner in the Buckingham Palace here; it's been a tale or woe since then with luck deserting him (as was also the case in this last year) and he'll pop up again sooner or later; 7f is ideal and has no ground preferences.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column32: The Ffrench Revolution & Mrs T Hamilton
column36: Bit flat at Newbury last time but his previous third here brings him into the equation
column37: Beaten when hampered at Newbury two weeks ago (behind Tarkhan and others in here) but a reproduction of his third here the time before when close up behind Native Warrior and Great Acclaim would see him competitive (raced wide that day); more rain the better.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Right out the back in two 7f handicaps for current yard and now tries blinkers
column37: 7f AW novice winner for Roger Varian; only had the eight races but right out the back in two 7f handicaps for current yard and now tries blinkers.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Only 3lb higher than for recent win here and course form here is a big selling point
column37: Came from well off the pace to win nicely over C&D a month ago, taking his form figures at Ascot to 23047131 and those were in fierce handicaps; only 3lb higher than last time and course form here is a big selling point.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: Given every chance to pick at Newbury (7f, good to soft) but failed to do so
column37: Consistent 3yo who hasn't had a lot of racing, but following two thirds in 1m1f/1m Goodwood handicaps, he was given every chance to pick at Newbury (7f, good to soft) but failed to do so; others preferred.

column20: 4/1 Native Warrior, 13/2 Great Acclaim, 8/1 Hickory, 12/1 Rahmi,  Two Tribes,  Hafeet Alain,  Mirabeau,  Linwood, 14/1 Thunder Roar, 16/1 Carrytheone,  Purosangue,  Apiarist,  Akkadian Thunder, 20/1 Balmacara,  Tarkhan, 25/1 Jumby, 33/1 Yanifer, 50/1 Dosman
column36: He didn't get much luck last time at Newbury (7f, good to soft) off this much reduced mark
column37: He didn't get much luck last time at Newbury (7f, good to soft) off this much reduced mark; the type who could go well with Oliver Carmichael taking off 7lb, but confidence would be greater on faster ground.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap

column32: B Jordan, Brian Jordan, S Jordan & N McConnell
column36: Some good runs in hot handicaps this year but the forecast rain may help others more
column37: Last season's heroics haven't been repeated this year but he has run creditably in some hot handicaps, notably a close fifth at York's Ebor meeting; on a competitive mark but the forecast rain might aid others more.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Big run when third in the Portland latest (best in group); 2lb higher but he's a contender
column37: Gained his first handicap win when leading late in a 5f handicap at Goodwood in May; beaten off a 2lb lower mark on his last three starts but that doesn't tell the whole tale, especially in the Portland three weeks ago when he was nicely clear of the others to race nearest the stands' rail; has the ability to feature but slow starts are an issue; raced on good or faster this year but fully effective on soft as a 2yo.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Unable to build on his fine second at Epsom on Derby day (6f, soft); others more appealing
column37: Ran well at Epsom on Derby day (6f, soft) but unable to build on it in three good sprints since; dropping down the weights but others have more pressing claims.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Having good year & has strong C&D form; has won on good to soft but usually seen on faster
column37: He has enjoyed a revival for Robert Cowell this season, winning three 5f handicaps; down the field in the Portland three weeks ago but this isn't so demanding and he can call upon strong C&D form, including as recently as July; handles good to soft but usually seen on a faster surface.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Back to best with Haydock win last week (cheekpieces first time); up 6lb but not ruled out
column37: Good start for Stuart Williams when second in a Racing League handicap at Chepstow in August (6f, good); below par on next three starts (awkward leaving the stalls) but he was more smartly away at Haydock last week (5f, good to soft; cheekpieces first time) and found plenty for pressure to win a Class 2 handicap in good style; had the benefit of prime track position there and he's now 6lb higher but rain won't faze him and may yet rate higher.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column32: M McHale, J Munroe, M Guy & D Walshe
column36: Having a fine year, winning four times; awkward start didn't help him last time; player
column37: Big improver this year, winning for the fourth time when battling well in a 5f Racing League event at Southwell in August; a difficult start was a contributory factor in his lesser effort back at Southwell two weeks ago and he'll have the option to grab the rail here, if desired, with a slow starter drawn next door; may not have finished improving just yet.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: 3rd in this race last year off 3lb higher; yet to run a bad race at Ascot; one to consider
column37: Came into this race in fine form 12 months ago and he ran a solid race for third off a 3lb higher mark; off the mark for 2025 when winning at Ripon in April; results have perked up again since fitted with cheekpieces and he has run well in all three Ascot visits.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Several good C&D runs to her name; in good form but significant rain wouldn't help
column37: Prolific winner who has often run well over C&D; good runs on AW on her last two starts; wouldn't be suited by significant rainfall.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Made a winning stable debut at Newmarket in July but it has been a struggle since
column37: Returned from 314 days off to make a winning stable debut at Newmarket in July (5f, good to firm); not so good since but he's now 1lb lower than for that win; others still more appealing.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: On a competitive mark but last two runs underwhelming and others look more convincing
column37: Prominent racer; three 5f wins when trained by Karl Burke, the latest a handicap off 2lb lower last July; runner-up in two of her six runs for Mick Appleby but her last two starts need leaving well behind.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column32: Middleham Park Racing Lxxxi & E Burke
column36: On a losing run but down the weights and both runs last month were encouraging
column37: On a losing run dating back to April 2023; he has slipped a long way in the weights and both his recent turf runs have offered promise, looking in need of the run at York and then shaping well for a long way in the Ayr Silver Cup two weeks ago; should have a big run in him back at 5f and he handles any ground.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Won this race in 2022; more miss than hit in 2025 and risky, for all he's down the weights
column37: Won the corresponding event in 2022; a couple of runner-up finishes at Pontefract this season confirm he retains ability but it has still been an underwhelming campaign; handicapped accordingly but not sure he's in the form required to capitalise.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Having a good season but likely vulnerable on a rare 5f run
column37: Won two 6f handicaps (good ground) in the first half of the year; creditable efforts in defeat since but this is stronger than she is accustomed to and she's rarely seen over 5f.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap
column20: 5/1 Rosario, 6/1 King Of Light, 7/1 Venture Capital,  Roach Power, 8/1 Canon's House, 10/1 Jordan Electrics,  Fantasy Master, 12/1 Rhythm N Hooves,  Glamorous Breeze,  Silky Wilkie, 16/1 Dream Composer, 20/1 Harvanna,  Tiger Tulip, 25/1 Emperor Spirit, 33/1 Twilight Jet
column36: Enjoying a renaissance since back to 5f; up in class but dangerous to rule out at present
column37: He hasn't really looked back since dropping to 5f this summer, winning minor events at Ffos Las and Chepstow in July and easily landing a Class 5 at Ffos Las six days ago (5f, heavy); Newbury and Doncaster runs in August/September suggest he can still mix it in a higher grade and he looks well in under a 5lb penalty; the more rain to fall the better.

column4: Ascot Racecourse Supports Berks County FC Handicap

column37: Fourth foal from a low-grade 1m4f winner; seems unlikely to trouble the two Newmarket raiders on this debut outing.

column32: Hambleton Racing Xxxix & The Fab Four
column36: Won this last year but he's generally struggled for new yard since; lots to prove

column4: Arc £1Million Bonus Bigger Than Ever Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 7/2 Sweet Kiss, 4/1 Renewal, 7/1 Telepathic, 15/2 Naturalia, 8/1 Molinari, 9/1 Advancing, 10/1 Shimmering Sands, 14/1 Cloth Of Gold,  Ninth Life,  It's A Love Thing, 16/1 Lightening Company, 20/1 Natzor
column36: Unexposed 3yo; had excuse on soft last time and could be dangerous in new headgear
column37: Debut winner; gelded prior to finishing third in handicaps at Sandown (1m2f, good) and Kempton (1m3f; both runs in cheekpieces) in August and he had an excuse on soft ground last month; still has potential after only five starts and could be dangerous in new headgear.

column4: Arc £1Million Bonus Bigger Than Ever Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 7/2 Sweet Kiss, 4/1 Renewal, 7/1 Telepathic, 15/2 Naturalia, 8/1 Molinari, 9/1 Advancing, 10/1 Shimmering Sands, 14/1 Cloth Of Gold,  Ninth Life,  It's A Love Thing, 16/1 Lightening Company, 20/1 Natzor
column36: Solid record in maiden/novice events and she's an interesting contender on handicap debut
column37: 210,000gns yearling; record of 4232 in novice/maiden events and she finished a clear second behind a subsequent winner at Ripon (1m, good) in July; out of a 1m2f Listed winner and she's an interesting contender now upped to this trip on handicap debut.

column4: Arc £1Million Bonus Bigger Than Ever Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 7/2 Sweet Kiss, 4/1 Renewal, 7/1 Telepathic, 15/2 Naturalia, 8/1 Molinari, 9/1 Advancing, 10/1 Shimmering Sands, 14/1 Cloth Of Gold,  Ninth Life,  It's A Love Thing, 16/1 Lightening Company, 20/1 Natzor
column32: Middleham Park Racing Cxv & C Barclay
column36: Pulled up over hurdles last time and last Flat win was in April 2023; down the list
column37: Won over hurdles at Cartmel (2m1f) in July but was pulled on his return visit the following month; on dangerous mark back on the Flat but has bit to prove after that last run and he's not won in this sphere since April 2023.

column4: Arc £1Million Bonus Bigger Than Ever Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 7/2 Sweet Kiss, 4/1 Renewal, 7/1 Telepathic, 15/2 Naturalia, 8/1 Molinari, 9/1 Advancing, 10/1 Shimmering Sands, 14/1 Cloth Of Gold,  Ninth Life,  It's A Love Thing, 16/1 Lightening Company, 20/1 Natzor
column36: Unexposed colt and had tough task in Class 2 on his comeback; one to keep an eye on
column37: In the first three late last year in his three qualifying runs (1m/1m2f, AW/soft); finished in rear on handicap debut at Ayr last month but that was in a Class 2 event after a lengthy absence; should benefit from that run and he needs checking in market on this big drop back in grade.

column4: Arc £1Million Bonus Bigger Than Ever Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

column32: Mr & Mrs G F Hall Racing
column36: Two wins here last autumn and has solid record this season; in the mix after a break
column37: First five wins were on turf but last two were at this track (1m2f/12.4f) last autumn; has solid record in five runs this season and he did best of the rest behind an improver who dominated here in July; dropped 1lb and he should go well again back in trip after a break.

column4: Arc £1Million Bonus Bigger Than Ever Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 7/2 Sweet Kiss, 4/1 Renewal, 7/1 Telepathic, 15/2 Naturalia, 8/1 Molinari, 9/1 Advancing, 10/1 Shimmering Sands, 14/1 Cloth Of Gold,  Ninth Life,  It's A Love Thing, 16/1 Lightening Company, 20/1 Natzor
column32: Buist, Shields, Thompson And Mrs R Carr
column36: Well held in both runs for current yard and needs to raise his game back on AW
