column37: Two C&D wins to her name; off the mark for the year in a 6f handicap at Ayr in August; fourth over C&D on Sunday but beaten 7l after a slow start; better than that.

column4: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Fillies' Handicap
column20: 6/5 Merapi, 4/1 Miss Yorkshire, 6/1 Highfield Sunshine,  Sibyl Charm,  Fistral Beach, 20/1 Samra Star
column36: In good form on AW earlier in the year; promising return last month; up in class
column37: In fine form on AW earlier in the year and she made an encouraging return from a summer break when fourth of ten at Wolverhampton last month; all wins at Class 6 level but this isn't competitive for the grade.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column36: Quirky but ran away with six-runner handicap at Ascot (1m2f, good to firm) in May latest
column37: Won two of her five races; has carried her head high and flashed tail, but she took steps forward over 9.4f and 1m before running away with a six-runner handicap over 1m2f at Ascot (good to firm) in May; 10lb higher today; further improvement seemed likely but she was non-runner (self certificate) for AW Group 3 in June; not seen since but looked good last time.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column36: Went close in Group 3 at Epsom (8.5f, good to soft) last June but disappointing since
column37: Went close in Group 3 at Epsom (8.5f, good to soft) last June but a long way below that level on her six outings since, four this season; drops in class and runs in her first handicap since September 2023; tried 1m2f once, when tailed off last June; plenty to prove.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column27: New England Stud & Mount Coote Stud
column36: 2-15 and her ideal ground seems to be soft or heavy; below form last two outings
column37: 2-15 and her ideal ground seems to be soft or heavy; tongue tied last four starts; third at Chester in June and she's now 6lb lower, but not nearly so good in her two races since and a downpour is seemingly needed.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column36: Went close on handicap debut at Glorious Goodwood (1m2f, good); faded tamely at York
column37: Well held on soft on her only 2yo run; won at Ascot (1m2f, good to firm) in May on return and went close on handicap debut at Glorious Goodwood (1m2f, good) in July; that saw her start second favourite at the York Ebor meeting (1m2f, good to firm) but, after racing up with the pace from a wide draw, she dropped out tamely; interesting to see if her backers return.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column36: Some creditable shows in defeat this term but well beaten on two of her last three starts
column37: The last of her four wins last season came over C&D (good to firm) in September, with earlier wins at 1m4f; some creditable shows this term but well beaten on two of her last three starts, the first of those following the same pattern as her other rare starts on softer than good.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column36: Four races; second on handicap debut at Windsor (1m2f, soft); flopped at 1m4f on AW debut
column37: Won a Salisbury novice (1m2f, good to firm) in May on her second start; good second on handicap debut at Windsor (1m2f, soft) in July but she flopped as favourite when trying 1m4f on AW debut over three weeks later; after four races, she should still be unexposed.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column36: Made all at Leicester (1m2f, good); a bit below that form eight days later (11.4f, soft)
column37: Won once as a 2yo and also when making all in six-runner handicap at Leicester (1m2f, good) in September; a little below that form under a penalty at Yarmouth (11.4f, soft) eight days later, again front-running, but should be more interesting now dropped back in trip.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column36: Six 2nds and two 3rds from her eight races; 2nd at York Ebor meeting before AW maiden flop
column37: Six seconds and two thirds from her eight races; best of those was in a handicap at the York Ebor meeting (1m2f, good to firm) on penultimate start but she was turned over at long odds-on in a maiden on latest, which has to prompt some caution despite that being her AW debut.

column4: British EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 15/8 Morrophore, 7/2 Wonder Star, 9/2 Blessed Star, 6/1 Princess Rascal, 12/1 Chic Colombine,  North Star, 20/1 Our Golden One,  Mrs Twig, 25/1 Aiming High
column36: Another AW last time but her only turf win was in 2022 and that's from 20 turf races
column37: Latest start brought her fourth AW success (Lingfield 1m4f) but it's striking that her only turf win was in 2022 and that's from 20 turf races; opposable on her 2025 turf form.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Third in a Group 2 and hasn't really had the breaks in subsequent sales races
column37: Debut winner and gelded after finishing third to top 2yo Zavateri in Group 2 July Stakes; no better than fourth in two sales races subsequently, though wasn't drawn great at Naas and didn't get the best of passages at Doncaster (extended 6f; good to soft); remains of interest and now tongue tied; 7f could suit; possible.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column32: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
column36: Has lots on at these weights and doesn't appear to be progressing
column37: Won his novice here over 6f in May; ran quite well in a nursery at Glorious Goodwood but pretty much tailed off in other four races since mid-June; has lots on at these weights.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Windsor maiden winner; after a break he was down the field in a sales race 23 days ago
column37: Won at Windsor and then ran creditably in the Woodcote at Epsom (again at 6f, good to soft); had 97 days off prior to finishing down the field in a sales race at Doncaster (extended 6f) and not overly appealing on the back of that.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Useful handicapper but probably lacks the scope for the improvement that he'll need
column37: Softening ground wouldn't harm having won his 7f Sandown nursery on soft and run perfectly well off his 4lb higher mark at Doncaster (good to soft); this is a different kettle of fish altogether and he probably lacks the scope for the improvement that he'll need.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Second in a 6f sales race on the July course; this has the look of a much deeper race
column37: Could improve for the step up to 7f as he was strong through the line when second in a 6f sales race on the July course, which was improved form; this has the look of a much deeper race, however.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Four-race maiden with ability but has no realistic chance on these terms
column37: Second and third runs were quite promising but over 6f and he trailed in last when upped to 7f on nursery debut at Doncaster; has no realistic chance on these terms.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column27: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
column36: Could well improve for 7f and tries blinkers, but others are far more convincing
column37: Fifth of 20 in a sales race on the July course (behind Court Alert) before probably raising his game to finish third in a small-field novice at Ascot (6f, soft); could well improve for 7f and tries blinkers, but others are far more convincing.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Competitive in recent nurseries but has no form claims in a race of this nature
column37: Competitive in 1m nurseries the last twice but off modest marks and has no form claims in a race of this nature.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace

6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Steps up to 7f but won't be good enough on what he's shown to date
column37: Unseated early on debut; no match for a talented rival at Windsor (good) and took a backward step at Newbury (good to soft); steps up to 7f but won't be good enough on what he's shown to date.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: 2-4 and the defeats have come in good races; considered off her weight
column37: Dual winner whose defeats have come in a French Group 3 and when second of 14 in a valuable series final at Goodwood (7f, good to soft); enters the reckoning off her weight.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Made all at Epsom (7f, good to soft) and brings momentum into his stiffest test yet
column37: Quite a spike in improvement when making all in an Epsom novice (7f, good to soft) and the second chased home a promising newcomer at Salisbury on Thursday; brings momentum into his stiffest test yet.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Off since early July when easily winning a weak race at Epsom; unexposed
column37: It was a weak race he won at Epsom (7f, good) three months ago but he did so easily and posted a useful RPR in the process; unexposed for his top yard but the weather needs watching, having been withdrawn from a subsequent engagement on account of good to soft ground.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Fulfilled previous promise when leading late on in a first-time hood at Lingfield (7f AW)
column37: Fulfilled previous promise when leading late on in a first-time hood at Lingfield (7f AW); that form is no advertisement to his prospects here but the stable brings them on steadily.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Scopey filly who has got on a roll and has leading claims off an advantageous weight
column37: Scopey filly who has got on a roll and wasn't overly pressed to complete her four-timer when making most in a nursery at the St Leger meeting over Doncaster's extended 6f (good to soft; has won on good to firm); gets in here off an advantageous weight having fetched 12,000gns as a yearling; clear claims.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: July course winner who may win another nursery but she looks outclassed here
column37: May have another nursery in her despite the 5lb rise for August's success on the July course (made all) but looks a bit outclassed here.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: 150-1 when second at Thirsk but he gave the useful winner a bit to think about
column37: 12,000gns half-brother to five winners; outran odds of 150-1 to finish a clear second at Thirsk (1m, good) and the winning favourite, who was given a fright, had previously chased home last week's Royal Lodge winner Bow Echo; with improvement on the cards, he's probably better in at these weights than a good many.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column32: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Graeme Curnow
column36: Tenth of 21 in a sales race at Doncaster and was unlucky not to finish closer than that
column37: Headed for a sales race at Doncaster (extended 6f, good to soft) with just about the weakest form claims and yet he finished a respectable tenth and would have been closer with a clearer run; there's guesswork involved to make a case but he's one to consider at lengthy odds.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Beaten in a seller latest; unlikely winner no matter what effect the new blinkers have
column37: Won a weak maiden at Chepstow (7f, good) and then finished fourth of six in a seller at Salisbury (heavy); an unlikely winner no matter what effect the new blinkers have.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Consistent thus far but has too much to find on the figures to warrant a second look
column37: Has advanced her RPR with each run but has too much to find on the figures to warrant a second look.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Would need to be decidedly talented to make a winning debut in this race
column37: 36,000gns yearling; first foal out of a 1m4f winner and half-sister to winners Amazing Maria (1m Group 1) and Constantino (useful 7f-9.5f); would need to be decidedly talented to make a winning debut in this race.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Latest respectable effort at Goodwood gives her a bit to find with Wetsand
column37: Found wanting in Listed races before finishing third of 14 in a series final at Goodwood, the form of which gives her a bit to find with Wetsand; there are others to worry about, too.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Proved a bargain at 20,000gns as that purchase price leaves her temptingly weighted here
column37: Lost her unbeaten record in a French Group 2 but bounced straight back to finish second in a conditions race at Newbury (7f, good to soft) when carrying a penalty, as was the unexposed winner; has proved a bargain at 20,000gns and that purchase price leaves her temptingly weighted here; entered in the Fillies' Mile.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column32: Hold My Beer, B Little & N Clark
column36: Highly tried in Group races last twice (6f; good to firm/soft) and never counted in either
column37: Ran well for a newcomer in the Queen Mary and then won at Windsor (6f, good); highly tried in Group races the last twice (6f; good to firm/soft) and never counted in either.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: 16,000gns yearling; this represents a severe test on introduction
column37: 16,000gns yearling; first foal out of a 7f/1m winner (mainly AW; RPR 78); this represents a severe test on introduction.

column20: 6/4 Half Sovereign, 4/1 True Test, 11/2 Colori Forever, 10/1 Starlight Time, 14/1 Jel Pepper,  Wetsand,  Accidental Bid, 25/1 Come On Eibhlin,  Mystic Moment,  Harlequin Angel,  Rosa Inglesa, 33/1 Runswick,  Logi Bear,  Blakefell,  Maria Da Silva,  Rising Empire, 50/1 Court Alert, 66/1 Hungarian,  Lady Hornblower,  You Sexy Thing,  What's The Plan, 100/1 Torbados,  Booziebrunch,  Elan d'Or,  Castrillo,  Poetic Grace
column36: Second to Colori Forever on debut; similar form when going one better at Chelmsford
column37: Couldn't cope with the finishing kick of Colori Forever at Yarmouth and probably performed to a similar level when going one better at Chelmsford (again at 7f); looks vulnerable.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column36: Improving filly but whether she's up to this class is debatable; rain would be a worry
column37: Made her name as a handicapper but popped up at 22-1 in a Group 3 at Ascot (1m, good) in July and was unlucky not to finish closer in America last time (1m Grade 3m, firm); however, whether she's up to this class is debatable, and rain could scupper things anyway (unraced on anything easier than good).

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column36: Top class filly who loves Newmarket but softening ground would be a big grey area
column37: Not at her best when a beaten favourite in a French 1m2f Group 1 last month but she's top class on her day and has a good record at Newmarket, even before winning the Group 2 Dahlia Stakes in May (1m1f) and adding the Group 1 Falmouth (1m) on the neighbouring July course; the glaring concern is the prospect of softening ground when she's been confined to good or quicker thus far.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column36: Looks as good as ever and she's uncomplicated filly who will race close to the lead
column37: Last year's Irish 1,000 Guineas winner; last three races in cheekpieces; didn't look in love with the fast ground when just behind Cinderella's Dream at Royal Ascot but has since been typically tenacious in winning Group 1s at Deauville (good) and Leopardstown (good to yielding); looks as good as ever and she's uncomplicated filly who will race close to the lead; hard to knock.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column32: L Boros, R& S Marchant & Partner
column36: Made if 5-5 in a Group 3 at Sandown, giving 6lb to Blue Bolt after an absence
column37: Lengthy absences are a feature in this lightly raced filly's profile but she's 5-5 and did well to overcome a break of 255 days to beat Blue Bolt in Sandown's Group 3 Atalanta Stakes, especially as she was conceding 6lb to the runner-up and dropped in from the widest stall; fully entitled to raise her game again on this first crack at a Group 1 and hard to know how good she might be.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column36: Has been well held the last twice in races won by Spiritual and Fallen Angel
column37: Has an excellent strike-rate on ground softer than good so appreciable rain would offer some hope for her outrunning lengthy odds; however, has been well held the last twice in races won by Spiritual and Fallen Angel.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column36: Good run when penalised in a Group 3 last time but that's her level
column37: Ran perfectly well under a penalty when third in the Group 3 Sceptre Stakes at Doncaster (7f, soft) but that's her level; comfortably held by some of today's principals on her previous two runs.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column32: Barry Fowler, Medallion Racing 2020 LLC, Steven I Weston
column36: Came from some way back to be a closing third behind Fallen Angel at Leopardstown
column37: Didn't make her debut until April and second time out beat the subsequent Coronation Stakes winner Cercene in a Group 3; has come up short in Group 1s won by Cinderella's Dream and Fallen Angel in her last three races, though she got closer to the Burke filly at Leopardstown when emerging from well of the pace in a first-time tongue-tie; that good to yielding ground was the slowest she's faced but wouldn't be exposed just yet.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column36: Fast-improving filly but not weighted to reverse Sandown placings with Lady of Spain
column37: Lightly raced and progressive filly who took the promotion to Listed level in her stride at Sandown (1m, good to firm) and again on her debut in a Group 3 when narrowly denied by Lady Of Spain on soft ground back there a month ago; however, she's 3lb worse off with her conqueror here so needs her best yet by some margin.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column27: Exors Of The Late Sir Robert Ogden
column36: Rallying fourth to Fallen Angel at Leopardstown; that entitles her to a second look
column37: Second in a Group 3 here last season; her fourth in the Coronation Stakes at Royal Ascot was her career high but probably surpassed that form when a rallying fourth to Fallen Angel in the Group 1 Matron at Leopardstown; seems able on most ground and not beyond the realms that she'll have some role to play in the finish.

column20: 7/4 Cinderella's Dream, 5/2 Fallen Angel, 6/1 Lady Of Spain, 13/2 Blue Bolt, 10/1 Atsila, 14/1 Cathedral, 25/1 Cheshire Dancer, 33/1 Saqqara Sands, 50/1 Spiritual, 100/1 Sparks Fly
column36: Toughest test yet but she's improving and won't mind what the weather does
column37: Never out of the first two in seven races and arrives here on a wave of improvement after going close in a Group 2 at Goodwood last month (1m, good to firm; won on soft and performed well on heavy); raised another level here but wouldn't be too dismissive should conditions take a turn for the worse.

column20: 5/2 Noble Journey, 11/4 Lyneham, 7/2 Echo Of Stars, 5/1 Interstate, 8/1 Arbaawy, 12/1 Temple, 20/1 Golden Caviar, 100/1 Suggy
column36: Twice second but he came up well short at Yarmouth (1m, good to soft) on latest outing
column37: Always-prominent second at Newmarket (7f, good to firm) and Windsor (1m, soft) on second and third starts; latter is among the best form in this field but he came up well short at Yarmouth (1m, good to soft) on latest outing.

column20: 5/2 Noble Journey, 11/4 Lyneham, 7/2 Echo Of Stars, 5/1 Interstate, 8/1 Arbaawy, 12/1 Temple, 20/1 Golden Caviar, 100/1 Suggy
column36: 13-2 from 10-1 for Ascot maiden (1m, soft) with promising late gains into fourth of five
column37: 100,000euros yearling by Sea The Stars; 13-2 from 10-1 for maiden at Ascot (1m, soft) four weeks ago, never dangerous but making late gains to be just over 1l fourth of five; the second and third won next time, while the fifth has since come runner-up; promising.

column20: 5/2 Noble Journey, 11/4 Lyneham, 7/2 Echo Of Stars, 5/1 Interstate, 8/1 Arbaawy, 12/1 Temple, 20/1 Golden Caviar, 100/1 Suggy
column36: 160,000gns yearling by Wootton Bassett; late foal; stable has had 2yo debut wins this term
column37: 160,000gns yearling by Wootton Bassett; second foal; dam well held over 1m2f/1m3f in France, sister to winners Kissed (1m2f Listed) and Dawn Patrol (2m Group 3), closely related to Derby winner Pour Moi, family of Oaks winner Snow Bride and Derby/Arc winner Lammtarra; late foal, probably one for later but his stable did have 2yo debut wins in August and September.

column20: 5/2 Noble Journey, 11/4 Lyneham, 7/2 Echo Of Stars, 5/1 Interstate, 8/1 Arbaawy, 12/1 Temple, 20/1 Golden Caviar, 100/1 Suggy
column36: 220,000gns yearling by Palace Pier; eighth foal; half-brother to five winners, one smart
column37: 220,000gns yearling by Palace Pier; eighth foal; half-brother to five winners, notably Start Of Day (French 9.7f/1m2f including Listed; RPR 111) and Ayacara (US Graded stakes-placed 7f/1m including 2yo; 100); dam unraced; late foal but from a top stable and needs a close look.

column20: 5/2 Noble Journey, 11/4 Lyneham, 7/2 Echo Of Stars, 5/1 Interstate, 8/1 Arbaawy, 12/1 Temple, 20/1 Golden Caviar, 100/1 Suggy
5/2 Noble Journey, 11/4 Lyneham, 7/2 Echo Of Stars, 5/1 Interstate, 8/1 Arbaawy, 12/1 Temple, 20/1 Golden Caviar, 100/1 Suggy
column36: First foal; by Frankel; dam French 1m2f-12.5f winner, including Group 1 Prix Vermeille
column37: First foal; by Frankel; dam French 1m2f-12.5f winner (including Group 1 Prix Vermeille; RPR 114); scoped wrong when non-runner at Haydock one week ago; powerful connections and he's very much one to note.

column20: 5/2 Noble Journey, 11/4 Lyneham, 7/2 Echo Of Stars, 5/1 Interstate, 8/1 Arbaawy, 12/1 Temple, 20/1 Golden Caviar, 100/1 Suggy
column36: Low-level form at Salisbury (6f, good to firm; 20-1) and Newbury (7f, good to soft; 150-1)
column37: Low-level form when 20-1 at Salisbury (6f, good to firm) and 150-1 at Newbury (7f, good to soft) over five weeks later.

column20: 5/2 Noble Journey, 11/4 Lyneham, 7/2 Echo Of Stars, 5/1 Interstate, 8/1 Arbaawy, 12/1 Temple, 20/1 Golden Caviar, 100/1 Suggy
column36: 575,000gns yearling by Wootton Bassett; dam useful sister to 1m 2yo Gr1 winner Kingsbarns
column37: 575,000gns yearling by Wootton Bassett; second foal; dam Listed-placed 10.5f/1m4f winner (RPR 101), sister to 1m 2yo Group 1 winner Kingsbarns, half-sister to winners Belle Artiste (7f Group 3) and Sweeter Still (US 1m Grade 3; dam of 2,000 Guineas winner Kameko); newcomer to note.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Hot Flame, 7/2 Orionis, 4/1 Perfect Your Craft, 6/1 Miss Wong, 8/1 Albany, 14/1 Alpine Oasis, 16/1 Wisper, 20/1 Loving Look
column36: Pipped at York (1m4f) on penultimate start; last of six on latest but that was over 1m2f
column37: Lightly raced 5yo who won on good to soft and heavy in previous campaigns and hit top form again when pipped in a 1m4f York handicap on good ground on penultimate start; last of six to Hot Flame when favourite on latest but return to 1m2f may help to explain that; worth a second look.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Hot Flame, 7/2 Orionis, 4/1 Perfect Your Craft, 6/1 Miss Wong, 8/1 Albany, 14/1 Alpine Oasis, 16/1 Wisper, 20/1 Loving Look
column36: Well beaten on latest start; first crack at 1m4f, which is quite interesting
column37: Won at Windsor (11.5f) in June and creditable fifth at Glorious Goodwood (1m2f) on penultimate start; well beaten latest (good to soft probably not to blame) and this is her first crack at 1m4f, which is quite interesting.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Hot Flame, 7/2 Orionis, 4/1 Perfect Your Craft, 6/1 Miss Wong, 8/1 Albany, 14/1 Alpine Oasis, 16/1 Wisper, 20/1 Loving Look
column36: 2-3; won 1m2f handicap latest; up 4lb but promising; has Group 1 entry at 1m4f this month
column37: Won at Yarmouth (1m, good to soft) last October on debut; seen only twice since, when racing freely early on reappearance in August, but still managing to finish second, and comfortably going one better in six-runner race for handicap debut at Haydock (1m2f, good; dictated the pace) five weeks later; up 4lb but promising and 1m4f looks plausible, indeed she has a Group 1 Champions Fillies & Mares entry over this trip in two weeks' time.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Hot Flame, 7/2 Orionis, 4/1 Perfect Your Craft, 6/1 Miss Wong, 8/1 Albany, 14/1 Alpine Oasis, 16/1 Wisper, 20/1 Loving Look
column36: Won the first and latest of her four handicaps, the latter comfortably in new headgear
column37: Reliable sort who won the first and latest of her four handicaps; wore first-time cheekpieces in the latter at Newbury (1m4f, good to soft) 15 days ago when she went on over 1f out to score comfortably; 7lb rise demands more but she could be set for better still in the headgear.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Hot Flame, 7/2 Orionis, 4/1 Perfect Your Craft, 6/1 Miss Wong, 8/1 Albany, 14/1 Alpine Oasis, 16/1 Wisper, 20/1 Loving Look
column36: Favourite all four starts, winning two; creditable fifth of 13 at Doncaster (1m4f) latest
column37: Favourite all four starts; edged ahead close home in a novice event at Salisbury (1m, heavy) last October and five-runner handicap at Doncaster (1m2f, good to soft) in July; creditable fifth of 13 in a strong race at Doncaster (1m4f, good to soft) on latest outing but she needs better.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Hot Flame, 7/2 Orionis, 4/1 Perfect Your Craft, 6/1 Miss Wong, 8/1 Albany, 14/1 Alpine Oasis, 16/1 Wisper, 20/1 Loving Look
column36: Off since March; another big question arises from this being her turf debut
column37: Scored in February and December (1m4f) last year; absent since a creditable run in March, so needs to prove her fitness, and another big question arises from this being her turf debut.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Hot Flame, 7/2 Orionis, 4/1 Perfect Your Craft, 6/1 Miss Wong, 8/1 Albany, 14/1 Alpine Oasis, 16/1 Wisper, 20/1 Loving Look
column36: Up 6lb but has a useful pedigree and more to give in this hat-trick bid
column37: Made the breakthrough at Kempton (1m3f, AW) in August in her second handicap and stayed on well to follow up at Yarmouth (11.4f, soft) 17 days ago; up 6lb but has a useful pedigree and more to give.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column20: 2/1 Hot Flame, 7/2 Orionis, 4/1 Perfect Your Craft, 6/1 Miss Wong, 8/1 Albany, 14/1 Alpine Oasis, 16/1 Wisper, 20/1 Loving Look
column36: 5lb lower than at start of this season; seemingly needs extra from the new tongue-tie
column37: 2-13 overall and 1-8 in handicaps, the handicap win in a four-runner race here (1m2f) last November; 5lb lower today than at start of this season but the first-time tongue-tie seemingly needs to make a difference.

column4: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 10/11 Castle Rock, 7/4 Sierra Sands, 12/1 Savvy Disko,  We're Goosers, 14/1 Ecclefechan
column36: Pleasing debut at Newmarket two weeks ago; open to considerable improvement; hard to beat
column37: 650,000gns breeze-up purchase; pleasing start to his career when keeping on for fourth at Newbury (7f, good to soft) a fortnight ago; hard to beat granted normal improvement.

column4: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 10/11 Castle Rock, 7/4 Sierra Sands, 12/1 Savvy Disko,  We're Goosers, 14/1 Ecclefechan

column4: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 10/11 Castle Rock, 7/4 Sierra Sands, 12/1 Savvy Disko,  We're Goosers, 14/1 Ecclefechan
column36: 140,000gns breeze-up 2yo; has four winning siblings and he needs a market check on debut
column37: 52,000gns yearling, 140,000gns breeze-up 2yo; eighth foal; closely related to 5f 2yo winner Corazon (including Group 3; RPR 101), half-brother to winners She Can Boogie (5f including 2yo; 94), Twafeeg (6.5f 2yo; 87) and Happy Tears (6f AW; 81); dam 5f 2yo winner (91); plenty to like on paper and he needs a market check.

column4: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 10/11 Castle Rock, 7/4 Sierra Sands, 12/1 Savvy Disko,  We're Goosers, 14/1 Ecclefechan
column36: Kept on well when second of ten in a newcomers' race 12 days ago; open to improvement
column37: Attracted some support on his Leicester debut 12 days ago (7f, good to soft) and he made a pleasing start with his keeping-on second of ten; that race was confined to newcomers and the form has yet to be tested but his stable's newcomers usually do better for a run.

column4: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 10/11 Castle Rock, 7/4 Sierra Sands, 12/1 Savvy Disko,  We're Goosers, 14/1 Ecclefechan
15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column36: Both runs last month were respectable but others in this line-up have more pressing claims
column37: Dual 6f AW winner; returned from five-month break with two respectable turf runs last month (7f/6f) and is not yet fully exposed after only six starts but others in this line-up have more pressing claims.

column20: 15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column36: Showed some useful 2yo form but has found things tough this season
column37: Showed some useful 2yo form but has found things tough this season (unplaced all four starts); didn't run badly when eighth at Thirsk (7f, good) last month but latest 2lb drop is not enough to tempt.

column20: 15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column36: Off since underwhelming handicap debut in September 2024 but probably still has potential
column37: Launched career with two 7f wins last summer; faded into sixth of eight after racing too freely on handicap debut at Kempton (7f, AW) just over a year ago and not seen again since but probably still has potential; dangerous to ignore.

column20: 15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column36: Began season with two close seconds in May but seems to have lost her way since
column37: Began season with two close seconds in May (7f/1m, good to firm) but seems to have lost her way since; finished last at Thirsk (7f, good) last month and has a lot more to prove than some of these.

column20: 15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column36: Yet to strike this year but last month's clear second over C&D was a good effort
column37: Four wins as a 2yo, including valuable C&D nursery on soft ground just over a year ago; 0-6 this year but her clear second over C&D (good) a fortnight ago was a good effort and she has each-way claims at least today.

column20: 15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column36: C&D novice winner; returns here after creditable second in valuable Ascot handicap
column37: Won C&D (good to soft) novice on debut last November and bettered her disappointing handicap debut when creditable second in valuable race at Ascot (1m, good to soft) last month; sure to be suited by return to this track; the one to beat.

column20: 15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column36: Maiden winner in Ireland in May; ran okay on stable debut; now switches to a handicap
column37: Won 7f Down Royal maiden on good ground for Dermot Weld in May, her second start; not quite in same form when sixth of eight for new stable at Kempton (7f, AW) in August but that certainly wasn't a bad run and she may still have potential; makes handicap debut here.

column20: 15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column32: Hambleton Racing Ltd XXXV & E Burke
column36: Placed over 6f recently but tendency to race too freely remains a worry; back up in trip
column37: Kept on well for third at Hamilton (6f, soft) a fortnight ago but is yet to win this season and her tendency to race too freely remains a nagging concern, particularly over this longer trip; versatile ground-wise.

column20: 15/8 Bright Times Ahead, 4/1 Bint Mohaather, 11/2 Naina, 7/1 Cognisance, 8/1 Greydreambeliever, 10/1 Rajala, 14/1 Orchid, 20/1 Saariselka, 25/1 Biniorella Bay
column36: Chased home improving filly at Sandown last month and will be suited by rain here
column37: Placed three consecutive times on turf since readily winning 7f Tapeta maiden on seasonal debut in June, most recently when second to improving filly at Sandown (7f, soft) three weeks ago; will be favoured by the forecast rain here; respected.

column4: Racing TV EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 4/7 Pandemonium, 15/8 Skiathos, 25/1 Itszaboy,  Fareenar,  Yorkies Dream

column4: Racing TV EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 4/7 Pandemonium, 15/8 Skiathos, 25/1 Itszaboy,  Fareenar,  Yorkies Dream
column36: First foal from a fair 1m4f winner; would be a rare winning newcomer for the stable
column37: First foal; dam 1m4f winner (RPR 69), half-sister to winners Horsefly (1m2f/1m4f), Time And Place (5f 2yo/6f), Belle Travers (7f 2yo/1m2f) and Highland Premiere (6f-1m 2yo); would be a rare winning newcomer for the stable.

column4: Racing TV EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 4/7 Pandemonium, 15/8 Skiathos, 25/1 Itszaboy,  Fareenar,  Yorkies Dream
column36: Brother to connections' Listed 5f 2yo winner Attagirl; interesting newcomer
column37: Sixth foal; brother to connections' Listed 5f 2yo winner Attagirl, half-brother to 5f/5.7f winner Symbol Of Hope (RPR 75); dam Italian 5f-6f 2yo winner (including Listed; 99), half-sister to Group-placed 5f 2yo winner Mr Scarlet; no surprise if he poses a significant threat on debut.

column4: Racing TV EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 4/7 Pandemonium, 15/8 Skiathos, 25/1 Itszaboy,  Fareenar,  Yorkies Dream
column36: Unable to land a significant blow when fifth of six over C&D on recent debut
column37: Slowly into stride and unable to land a significant blow when fifth of six over C&D (good to soft) on recent debut; needs a big step forward.

column4: Racing TV EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
column20: 4/7 Pandemonium, 15/8 Skiathos, 25/1 Itszaboy,  Fareenar,  Yorkies Dream
column32: T Cottier, On Top Racing, Amity Fin
column36: Out of a useful 2yo winner; refused to enter the stalls when 20-1 for intended debut
column37: Fourth foal; dam 6f/7f AW winner (including 2yo; RPR 90), half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Live Stream; refused to enter the stalls when 20-1 for last month's intended debut and has been declared with a hood this time; best watched.

column4: Watch Live Racing On Racing TV Handicap (Div I)
column20: 5/2 Mighty Quiet, 9/2 Solar Bentley, 5/1 Shipshape, 7/1 Four Fifty, 12/1 Jewel Maker,  Tetsworth,  Condotti, 14/1 Velvet Whisper,  Marry The Night, 16/1 Implied Volatility, 25/1 Lunar Jet
column36: Came from off the pace to score at Windsor last month; 3lb rise looks manageable
column37: Low-mileage 4yo; safely held on first three outings this season but came from behind to score at Windsor (1m2f, good) last month; probably still on workable mark after 3lb rise and will be favoured by rain; good chance.

column4: Watch Live Racing On Racing TV Handicap (Div I)
column20: 5/2 Mighty Quiet, 9/2 Solar Bentley, 5/1 Shipshape, 7/1 Four Fifty, 12/1 Jewel Maker,  Tetsworth,  Condotti, 14/1 Velvet Whisper,  Marry The Night, 16/1 Implied Volatility, 25/1 Lunar Jet
column36: May have been flattered when winning by 6l last month; others look better handicapped
column37: Drew clear to win amateur riders' contest at Carlisle (1m, good) last month but was probably flattered by the way that race panned out; safely held on latest outing and may find others better handicapped again.

column4: Watch Live Racing On Racing TV Handicap (Div I)
column20: 5/2 Mighty Quiet, 9/2 Solar Bentley, 5/1 Shipshape, 7/1 Four Fifty, 12/1 Jewel Maker,  Tetsworth,  Condotti, 14/1 Velvet Whisper,  Marry The Night, 16/1 Implied Volatility, 25/1 Lunar Jet
column32: Blue Candi Lab Ltd & Julie Camacho
column36: Faded after making the running in first two handicaps; visor added here

column36: 0-10 since debut win in June

column37: Fourth in this race 12 months ago and arrives in decent form after a never-nearer third at Newcastle last week; holds no secrets from the handicapper but has reasonable each-way claims.

column4: Marske Fabrications & Engineering Straight-Mile Series Final Handicap

column37: In prime form in July, winning twice (7f/1m) at Ayr, but the wheels seem to have come off since and he beat only one home on the same course last time; others preferred.

column4: Marske Fabrications & Engineering Straight-Mile Series Final Handicap

column36: 3-3 here, latest win in August; may still have untapped potential; big shout
column37: Progressive 3yo; loves Redcar and extended his unbeaten record here when making all over C&D in August, from Debora's Dream who went one better next time; wasn't beaten far in a big field at York on latest start and almost certainly remains in form; may still have untapped potential; big shout.

column4: Marske Fabrications & Engineering Straight-Mile Series Final Handicap

column37: Sole win came in 2022 and he wasn't at his best when fifth at Newcastle last time (split Leadenhall and Barley); his yard has more obvious claims with the in-form Jez Bomb, but this one was a good second over C&D in August and can't be discounted completely.

column4: Marske Fabrications & Engineering Straight-Mile Series Final Handicap

column37: Showed his liking for Redcar with C&D wins in June and July; things haven't gone to plan since but he met trouble here in August and a heavy defeat last time came in the Legends race at Doncaster; not inconceivable he'll bounce back.

column4: Marske Fabrications & Engineering Straight-Mile Series Final Handicap

column37: Hardy veteran with 12 wins to his name; two of them came this term, at Beverley (1m2f, good to firm) and Carlisle (1m, soft); only 3lb higher than for the second success but this race is more competitive.

column36: Scraped home over 2m last Saturday (first win that far); return to 1m6f is no disincentive
column37: Won in Class 6 on soft and good to soft last year but withdrawn from good to soft on Thursday; first six wins were 1m6f, including at Newmarket this August, and he travelled much the best at Ripon (2m) one week ago before scraping home in front; up 3lb but return to 1m6f is clearly no disincentive and two of his wins last year were separated by only five days; player.

column20: 2/1 Division Day, 3/1 The Crafty Mole, 4/1 Sourdough, 8/1 Atlantic Sunset,  Red Derek, 9/1 Kitsune Power, 12/1 Peaky Blinder
column36: Cheekpieces last two starts, best form first occasion but beaten 15l in a handicap latest

column20: 2/1 Division Day, 3/1 The Crafty Mole, 4/1 Sourdough, 8/1 Atlantic Sunset,  Red Derek, 9/1 Kitsune Power, 12/1 Peaky Blinder
2/1 Division Day, 3/1 The Crafty Mole, 4/1 Sourdough, 8/1 Atlantic Sunset,  Red Derek, 9/1 Kitsune Power, 12/1 Peaky Blinder
column36: Won in first-time visor but disappointing in it since; gelded since latest start; new trip
column37: Won at Newmarket (1m4f, good to firm) in June with a first-time visor (replacing usual blinkers) but he was below form next time and tailed-off last of three on latest, both also at Newmarket; 1m6f is plausible but it's the gelding operation which seemingly needs to prompt a turnaround.

column20: 2/1 Division Day, 3/1 The Crafty Mole, 4/1 Sourdough, 8/1 Atlantic Sunset,  Red Derek, 9/1 Kitsune Power, 12/1 Peaky Blinder

column37: Thirsk (1m6f) last June was his only win in the last three years; has a career-low mark and some minor honours this term but others bring more pressing claims.

column20: 2/1 Division Day, 3/1 The Crafty Mole, 4/1 Sourdough, 8/1 Atlantic Sunset,  Red Derek, 9/1 Kitsune Power, 12/1 Peaky Blinder
column36: Best 2025 form latest, but 2-51 overall (latest win in 2022) and 8lb out of the handicap
column37: Close third at Haydock (1m6f) eight days ago was much his best form this season, but he's 2-51 overall and the last of those wins was in 2022; there's also the burden of being 8lb out of the handicap.

column36: Two fourths for this yard have been encouraging; good-value claimer booked; interesting

column37: Old-timer who has won 11 times; has shown he retains some ability in two outings this term, typically doing his best work late on when fourth of 14 at Haydock four weeks ago; not without hope if the gaps appear.

column36: Best runs this year at Thirsk; only sixth at Southwell last time; needs to bounce back
column37: Two standout efforts for this yard have come at Thirsk, winning in June and runner-up in August (both 5f, good to firm; probably handles good to soft); faded when only sixth at Southwell 11 days ago; stablemate of Ventura Express.

column36: Legendary sprinter with 17 wins; good second at Ripon seven days ago; in the mix
column37: Legendary sprinter whose 17 wins include five at Chester and seven at York (having his first run at Redcar today); good second at Ripon seven days ago and he's in the mix again off just 1lb higher.

column37: Struggled when switched to turf at Musselburgh last month but he showed promise in first two runs including when third in 7f maiden at this track; this trip should be within range on pedigree and he needs checking in market on handicap debut; tongue-tie added.

column4: Bet Boost At bet365 Nursery Handicap

column37: Mixed results in her five starts but she ran well to finish a clear second when upped to 1m in Kempton nursery (AW) last month; cheekpieces are now added and has claims if she can build on that last run.

column4: Bet Boost At bet365 Nursery Handicap
column20: 15/8 Kalokalo, 4/1 Vintage Heat, 6/1 Paroled, 13/2 Hamaleel, 8/1 Ibn Altheeb, 10/1 Hakin Adraar,  Senor Campanaro,  Forceful Lady
column36: Five-race maiden who hasn't progressed so far and others are preferred
column37: Made an encouraging nursery debut when third here (7f) in August but he failed to build on that at Beverley (8.4f) last month; the soft ground may have been an issue last time but he hasn't progressed so far and others preferred; cheekpieces added.

column4: Bet Boost At bet365 Nursery Handicap
column20: 15/8 Kalokalo, 4/1 Vintage Heat, 6/1 Paroled, 13/2 Hamaleel, 8/1 Ibn Altheeb, 10/1 Hakin Adraar,  Senor Campanaro,  Forceful Lady
column36: Handicap newcomer and he's a possible improver on this step up in trip; watch market
column37: 70,000gns yearling; beaten 9l or more in his three qualifying runs at around 7f but a slow start didn't help at Kempton two weeks ago; now switches to a nursery and this Palace Pier colt is a possible improver on this step up in trip.

column4: Bet Boost At bet365 Nursery Handicap
column20: 15/8 Kalokalo, 4/1 Vintage Heat, 6/1 Paroled, 13/2 Hamaleel, 8/1 Ibn Altheeb, 10/1 Hakin Adraar,  Senor Campanaro,  Forceful Lady
column36: Made all at Yarmouth two weeks ago and he's open to more progress; big player up 4lb
column37: Runner-up on nursery debut at Leicester (7f, good) before landing the odds with an all-the-way win over 1m at Yarmouth (good to soft); 4lb higher on this switch to AW but he's improved with each of his five runs and could continue on an upward curve; big player.

column4: Bet Boost At bet365 Nursery Handicap
column20: 15/8 Kalokalo, 4/1 Vintage Heat, 6/1 Paroled, 13/2 Hamaleel, 8/1 Ibn Altheeb, 10/1 Hakin Adraar,  Senor Campanaro,  Forceful Lady
column36: Opening mark looks on the high side but he's unexposed and ran a promising race last time
column37: Well held in first two runs but he got much closer to the target when runner-up in a Brighton maiden (1m, good to soft) last month; opening mark looks on the high side but it's still early days and he should have more to offer in nurseries; cheekpieces added.

column4: Bet Boost At bet365 Nursery Handicap

column36: Eyecatching third over 7f here latest and he looks interesting on this step up in trip
column37: Too Darn Hot colt who is out of 1m/8.5f winner; no impact in four runs so far but he made some late headway when third on nursery debut here (7f) 12 days ago; that was eyecatching and he looks interesting on this step up in trip.

column4: Bet Boost At bet365 Nursery Handicap

column37: Down the field at big prices in her three qualifying runs but she was only beaten around 4l at Chepstow (7f, good) last time; this is more realistic on nursery debut and she's bred to stay this new trip; one to keep an eye on.

column37: Fair form at 7f, highlighted by a 6l maiden win at Limerick and third in a conditions event at Gowran two weeks ago; has never run in a sprint; yard's older runner Gutsy Girl looks superior on figures and trip-profile.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column32: Nigel O'Hare/D W Sloan/Milena C Mocchetti/Kabin Racing Synd
column36: 3yo on a hat-trick, raised 13lb for easy win latest, this tougher but should go well again
column37: Progressive 3yo followed up an easy Dundalk maiden win (7f) with another wide margin victory on handicap debut at Down Royal (7f, yielding); raised 13lb, this harder but has 6f form on soft and should go well again.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column32: N W T Dalzell/James Morgan/Karl Kirwan/Mrs John Murphy
column36: Won in fine style at Naas in April off 9lb lower, not disgraced in Bold Lad, more needed
column37: 3yo scored by 7.5l at Naas in April off 74; raised 13lb and has come up short in both handicap starts since, though wasn't disgraced in the Bold Lad on latest; dropped 2lb but more needed off this mark.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column36: Won off 12lb lower on penultimate, beaten off revised mark latest, course form a negative
column37: One of two for yard; back to form with a 3.5l win at Cork (6f, soft) on penultimate off 68; raised 12lb and no impact upped to 1m at that same venue latest; course form is poor; others preferred.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column36: Two-time C&D winner, 1lb below last win, denied a clear run in Bold Lad latest, big player
column37: Two-time C&D winner and is now 1lb below his last victory; denied a clear run when not beaten that far in the Bold Lad when 8lb wrong; testing ground fine and the race should be run to suit this hold up performer.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column36: Three wins this season at Fairyhouse, j2lb above last win, handles soft, not discounted
column37: Racked up a good ground hat-trick in a 6f claimer and two 6f handicaps at Fairyhouse in May-June; unseated soon after the start at Listowel on latest; is just 2lb above his last win and has placed form on soft so not discounted.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column27: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
column36: C&D win off 6lb higher in March, well beaten at Cork latest, new headgear needs to revive
column37: Nine-time winner, most recently over C&D (soft) off 6lb higher in March; well behind Gerrit's Gem at Cork on latest; new headgear combination needs to spark a revival, well-treated if it does.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column36: Poor at Cork latest, has solid course form, rider takes off 7lb, may outrun odds back here
column37: One of two for yard; prominent racer disappointed behind stablemate Gerrit's Gem at Cork latest (6f, soft); won his maiden over C&D and has run well his on last five visits here; good claimer takes off 7lb may outrun odds back at this venue.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column32: Ms H McGuinness/Martin W White/Declan Sheridan/Breen White
column36: Won over 7f here in May, 1lb lower now but recent form has been well below par
column37: Beat Pinar Del Rio by 2l over 7f here (good) on seasonal reappearance in May; 1lb lower now but his recent form hasn't indicated that a return to winning ways is imminent.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio
column36: Behind Gerrit's Gem at Cork, better off at weights, gone well here before, can't discount
column37: Finished 3.5l behind Gerritt's Gem off 3lb lower at Cork on penultimate; better off at weights now and posted a couple of solid efforts in maidens over this C&D; below best at Listowel latest but return to this venue could spark; don't discount.

column20: 6/4 Bishopton, 11/2 Gerrit's Gem, 13/2 Dmaniac, 8/1 Unique Journey, 9/1 I Bid You Ajou, 10/1 Jon Riggens, 11/1 Verhoyen, 14/1 Goal Exceeded, 16/1 Laugh A Minute, 20/1 Pinar Del Rio

column37: Admirable front-runner has won over C&D but his last four victories have come over 7f; well handicapped on last year's form; disappointed at Fairyhouse latest but was drawn wide; ground versatile; bold bid likely.

column37: Bounced back to form with a Roscommon win on penultimate (7.5f, soft) off 76; raised 6lb and no impact at Listowel (7f, heavy) latest; needs to rebound from that effort stepped back up to 1m.

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
column20: 3/1 Great Mover, 9/2 Flying Fortress, 7/1 Quatre Bras, 15/2 Refreshment, 10/1 Highbury See See, 11/1 Gran Habano, 12/1 Earls, 14/1 Shoot To Kill,  Loingseoir, 16/1 Selective Power,  Ransom, 18/1 Tashir, 22/1 Ardeur, 25/1 Razdan, 33/1 Mr Rango
column36: 6l defeat at Laytown on first run for this yard, rain softened ground a worry
column37: Twelve-time winner was beaten 6l on his first run for this yard at Laytown (7f); won a Gowran claimer comfortably on his previous start (1m, good); rain softened ground not in his favour.

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
column20: 3/1 Great Mover, 9/2 Flying Fortress, 7/1 Quatre Bras, 15/2 Refreshment, 10/1 Highbury See See, 11/1 Gran Habano, 12/1 Earls, 14/1 Shoot To Kill,  Loingseoir, 16/1 Selective Power,  Ransom, 18/1 Tashir, 22/1 Ardeur, 25/1 Razdan, 33/1 Mr Rango
column36: Course winner, below par again here latest, well treated now but needs to rediscover best
column37: Hasn't really fired since a close fourth over his C&D (heavy) in April 2024 off 88; 12lb lower now but didn't build on mildly promising Clonmel fourth over 1m2f here on latest, though that was a hot race; well-treated but revival needed.

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
column20: 3/1 Great Mover, 9/2 Flying Fortress, 7/1 Quatre Bras, 15/2 Refreshment, 10/1 Highbury See See, 11/1 Gran Habano, 12/1 Earls, 14/1 Shoot To Kill,  Loingseoir, 16/1 Selective Power,  Ransom, 18/1 Tashir, 22/1 Ardeur, 25/1 Razdan, 33/1 Mr Rango
column36: In fine form this year, another good effort in rated race latest, may not want it too soft
column37: Has enjoyed a fine campaign; back to back wins in June saw him go up 13lb but he has continued to acquit himself well; another sound run in a Killarney rated race latest (1m, good); probably doesn't want it too soft.

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
column20: 3/1 Great Mover, 9/2 Flying Fortress, 7/1 Quatre Bras, 15/2 Refreshment, 10/1 Highbury See See, 11/1 Gran Habano, 12/1 Earls, 14/1 Shoot To Kill,  Loingseoir, 16/1 Selective Power,  Ransom, 18/1 Tashir, 22/1 Ardeur, 25/1 Razdan, 33/1 Mr Rango
column27: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
column36: Slowly away again at Down Royal latest, C&D winner is capable but a risky proposition
column37: Tardy starts have been a recurring theme for this C&D winner (heavy); very slowly away again on latest at Down Royal (1m5f, yielding); can't afford to miss the break badly at this trip; capable but risky; cheekpieces left off.

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
column20: 3/1 Great Mover, 9/2 Flying Fortress, 7/1 Quatre Bras, 15/2 Refreshment, 10/1 Highbury See See, 11/1 Gran Habano, 12/1 Earls, 14/1 Shoot To Kill,  Loingseoir, 16/1 Selective Power,  Ransom, 18/1 Tashir, 22/1 Ardeur, 25/1 Razdan, 33/1 Mr Rango

column37: Sole success a 6f maiden at Pontefract (good) last year for Ralph Beckett; 33-1 and beaten 10.5l on debut for this yard at Punchestown; yet to prove she handles easy ground; others preferred.

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap
column20: 3/1 Great Mover, 9/2 Flying Fortress, 7/1 Quatre Bras, 15/2 Refreshment, 10/1 Highbury See See, 11/1 Gran Habano, 12/1 Earls, 14/1 Shoot To Kill,  Loingseoir, 16/1 Selective Power,  Ransom, 18/1 Tashir, 22/1 Ardeur, 25/1 Razdan, 33/1 Mr Rango

column37: 3yo has won twice this season, including on latest at Listowel (8.5f, heavy) off 4lb lower (Quatre Bras 0.75l behind); ground conditions fine and should go well again if proving as effective on this track.

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap

column4: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Apprentice Handicap

column37: Flat wins have been at about 1m2f and on good and yielding ground; not as good as she was and conditions are a concern.

column20: 6/1 Kaikoura, 15/2 Lightning Legs,  Leroy Leroy, 8/1 Corkbeg, 17/2 Elusive Prince,  Shing Shilla, 9/1 Thats All, 10/1 Sea The Sunset,  Rebelle Chaud, 11/1 Ag Obair Go Crua, 14/1 Rodney Bay, 15/1 The Toothpicker, 18/1 Another Girl, 25/1 El Regalo, 33/1 County Graduate, 50/1 Royal Diver, 66/1 Chasing Crowns

column36: Useful handicapper at his best, ended a run of poor form on his final start last season
column37: Runner-up in the 2024 Fred Winter; won the Lartigue (big 4yo handicap) at Listowel last year; ended a run of poor form with Fairyhouse second on his final start last season; had a spin in a charity race at the Curragh in late-August, so no fitness doubts.

column20: 7/2 Arctic Gale, 4/1 Cinammon Roll, 5/1 Custom Taylor, 6/1 Carried With Love, 8/1 Eagles Reign,  Duty Bound,  Jacovec Cavern, 10/1 Cheerful Chap,  Kalanisi Flash, 14/1 Watch The Weather, 25/1 History Of Fashion
column32: Dr Brid Corkery & Mrs Mary C O'Connor
column36: On the upgrade when last seen in April, interesting with an experienced 7lb claimer aboard
column37: On a hat-trick after wins in a 3m maiden hurdle at Limerick and off 122 in a 2m7f Listed novice handicap hurdle at Fairyhouse; stays well and is suited by plenty of ease in the ground; interesting with an experienced 7lb claimer aboard.

column20: 7/2 Arctic Gale, 4/1 Cinammon Roll, 5/1 Custom Taylor, 6/1 Carried With Love, 8/1 Eagles Reign,  Duty Bound,  Jacovec Cavern, 10/1 Cheerful Chap,  Kalanisi Flash, 14/1 Watch The Weather, 25/1 History Of Fashion

column36: Won twice over fences last season, needs to improve on this term's chase/hurdles form

column37: Maiden hurdle winner over 2m at Cork last season; seemed to appreciate the step up to 2m6f with a career-best third at Killarney in August; backed that up with a similar performance at Ballinrobe; a first handicap success could be imminent.

column20: 7/2 Arctic Gale, 4/1 Cinammon Roll, 5/1 Custom Taylor, 6/1 Carried With Love, 8/1 Eagles Reign,  Duty Bound,  Jacovec Cavern, 10/1 Cheerful Chap,  Kalanisi Flash, 14/1 Watch The Weather, 25/1 History Of Fashion
column36: In good form over fences before a poor Kilbeggan run for which a plausible excuse emerged
column37: Three wins over hurdles; placed in six consecutive attempts over fences between May 2024 and March 2025; fine second in Listed novice handicap chase at Navan in March; had a possible excuse (skin scrapes) when beaten favourite at Kilbeggan in June; trip-versatile.

column20: 7/2 Arctic Gale, 4/1 Cinammon Roll, 5/1 Custom Taylor, 6/1 Carried With Love, 8/1 Eagles Reign,  Duty Bound,  Jacovec Cavern, 10/1 Cheerful Chap,  Kalanisi Flash, 14/1 Watch The Weather, 25/1 History Of Fashion
column36: Seems to have had issues, could be in the mix if he has progressed from a recent comeback
column37: Won a 2m6f maiden hurdle at Downpatrick in May 2024 before a lengthy break; could be in the mix if he has progressed from a recent comeback at the same venue.

column20: 7/2 Arctic Gale, 4/1 Cinammon Roll, 5/1 Custom Taylor, 6/1 Carried With Love, 8/1 Eagles Reign,  Duty Bound,  Jacovec Cavern, 10/1 Cheerful Chap,  Kalanisi Flash, 14/1 Watch The Weather, 25/1 History Of Fashion
column36: Two similar efforts in fifth since a Killarney win, Eoin Staples takes off a valuable 7lb
column37: Took a climb in the weights for wins at Listowel and Killarney in the early part of the season; similar efforts in fifth on his last two starts; Eoin Staples takes off a valuable 7lb.

column36: Now 0-15 over hurdles, second in a maiden on latest, fair third in a handicap before that
column37: Now 0-15 over hurdles; second in a maiden at Navan on latest, fair third in a handicap at Bellewstown before that; may continue to find one or two too good.

column20: 7/2 Arctic Gale, 4/1 Cinammon Roll, 5/1 Custom Taylor, 6/1 Carried With Love, 8/1 Eagles Reign,  Duty Bound,  Jacovec Cavern, 10/1 Cheerful Chap,  Kalanisi Flash, 14/1 Watch The Weather, 25/1 History Of Fashion
column36: Not everything went to plan over fences at Galway, every chance now in first-time blinkers
column37: Bumper winner in 2023; won a beginners' chase at Tipperary in June; third in a 2m6f handicap on the first of two hurdle runs at the Galway festival; not everything went to plan over fences at the same venue last month; every chance now in first-time blinkers.

column20: 7/2 Arctic Gale, 4/1 Cinammon Roll, 5/1 Custom Taylor, 6/1 Carried With Love, 8/1 Eagles Reign,  Duty Bound,  Jacovec Cavern, 10/1 Cheerful Chap,  Kalanisi Flash, 14/1 Watch The Weather, 25/1 History Of Fashion
column36: Veteran is best known as a thorough stayer over fences, unlikely to feature over this trip
column37: Veteran won back-to-back handicaps over fences at Down Royal and Fairyhouse (3m5f Porterstown Chase) late last year; best known as a thorough stayer; unlikely to feature in a hurdle race over this trip.

column20: 13/8 Western Fold, 2/1 Blood Destiny, 9/2 Affordale Fury, 13/2 Monbeg Park, 8/1 Rebel Gold
column36: Very useful but has often failed to perform in line with market expectations, vulnerable
column37: Has reached the first three in all nine completed starts over fences; three wins, the most recent was virtually meaningless when a 1-8 shot at Listowel in June; doubts raised by two cases of beaten favouritism from three starts last season, four instances earlier in his career, and another when failing to cope with Zanahiyr (his only serious rival) at Galway two months ago.

column20: 13/8 Western Fold, 2/1 Blood Destiny, 9/2 Affordale Fury, 13/2 Monbeg Park, 8/1 Rebel Gold
column36: Former smart staying novice hurdler, ran well on only start last season, best over further
column37: High-class form in staying novice hurdles in the first half of 2023, twice runner-up in Grade 1 races; novice chase campaign two seasons ago was cut short after Galway win and a very disappointing run at Punchestown; ran only once last season, fine effort until making a bad mistake at the last in a 3m Fairyhouse event; this trip is shorter than ideal.

column20: 13/8 Western Fold, 2/1 Blood Destiny, 9/2 Affordale Fury, 13/2 Monbeg Park, 8/1 Rebel Gold
column36: Pulled up in 3m Kerry National on first start for Jack Foley, this trip may suit better
column37: Useful novice last season; slotted into handicaps effectively; seasonal highlight provided by victory in a 2m5f Listed handicap at Leopardstown in March; formerly trained by Sean Doyle; faded from three out and pulled up in the Kerry National on his first start for Jack Foley; this shorter trip may be closer to his optimum.

column20: 13/8 Western Fold, 2/1 Blood Destiny, 9/2 Affordale Fury, 13/2 Monbeg Park, 8/1 Rebel Gold
column32: R Kennedy & Michael O'Dowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan
column36: Veteran who continued to show ability and enthusiasm last season, lacks a recent outing
column37: Veteran whose chase record stands at 4-25, thanks to the addition of a handicap win at Wexford in April; not disgraced as a 33-1 outsider in a Grade 2 contest at Fairyhouse later that month, fourth of five finishers then, only one length behind Blood Destiny; may need this after a break.

column20: 13/8 Western Fold, 2/1 Blood Destiny, 9/2 Affordale Fury, 13/2 Monbeg Park, 8/1 Rebel Gold
column36: Stylish winner of Galway Plate, shorter trip a concern, plenty going for him all the same
column37: Has improved in leaps and bounds since second over this trip at Clonmel in March; has looked very much at home over longer trips in landing a beginners' event at Tipperary, the Mayo National at Ballinrobe, and the Galway Plate; has gone up 19lb for his two handicap wins, making him the pick at these weights; shorter trip a concern, plenty going for him all the same.

column37: Point winner; two hurdle wins at this trip; best of seven chase runs when third over 2m2f at Galway on penultimate outing; needs to bounce back from a below-par run in a Kilbeggan race won buy A Wave Of The Sea; first-time cheekpieces.

column37: Won twice over hurdles last season and finished a respectable third to Rocky's Diamond in the Galmoy Hurdle at this venue; not disgraced as an 80-1 chance when sixth in the Stayers' at Cheltenham; remote eighth at Punchestown on final start; has not looked a natural over fences in his three chase runs in the previous season; needs more fluency.
